column2: Share of Direct Taxes in Centre's Gross Tax Revenue
column6: The government’s expectation on indirect tax collection is relatively higher compared to direct taxes, provided that indirect taxes are more regressive in nature. In the 2016-17 BE the proportion of direct taxes and indirect taxes is estimated at 52:48 which is less than 2014-15 actual figure of 56:44.
column22: Compiled by CBGA from Economic Survey 2015-16 and Reserve Bank of India statistics

column2: Share of Indirect Taxes in Centre's Gross Tax Revenue
column6: The government’s expectation on indirect tax collection is relatively higher compared to direct taxes, provided that indirect taxes are more regressive in nature. In the 2016-17 BE the proportion of direct taxes and indirect taxes is estimated at 52:48 which is less than 2014-15 actual figure of 56:44.
column22: Compiled by CBGA from Economic Survey 2015-16 and Reserve Bank of India statistics

column23: Data for year 2015-16 is a projected value.

column2: Revenue foregone as a % of Tax Revenue
